Description: Tall rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; lip and handle zone reserved with band between; trace of handle root at left; inscription on interior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: The number 103 is written in ink on the interior surface of the sherd. Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9A South Ionian cup with everted rim. The type closely follows the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Graffito inscriptions on the interior surface of Ionian cups are rare, being usually found on the exterior.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 103)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 649, no. 65)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 50, no. 94)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.391) (Phase 3)
